result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffery J Riley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling or any other activity deemed appropriate by Agent.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department

timeConds.notes:
Apply 53 days sentence credit.
TIME SERVED.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS Eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS Eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Sentence credit of 280 days were granted. 
Commencing forthwith.

superMiscConds.notes: Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions.

No association with any known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
  Maintain full time employment and/or school combination or any other activity deemed appropriate by Agent.
  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
  Provide DNA Sample if not yet already previously obtained.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Costs and Fines previously ordered by the Court to be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

superTimeConds.notes: To be performed as a condition of extended supervision.

Defendant Jeffery J Riley in court, in custody, with attorney Katie B. Kegel.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

COUNT #2
IMPOSED SENTENCE of: 

3 YEARS 6 MONTHS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 280 days), commencing forthwith. 
  -  1 YEAR 6 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  2 YEAR(S) OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain full time employment and/or combination of schooling 
or any other activity deemed appropriate by agent.
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
*No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
*Perform 60 Hours Community Service. 

COSTS AND FINES PREVIOUSLY ORDERED BY THE COURT TO BE PAID AS A CONDITION OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

Defendant is  eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is  eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
